reasoning_trace.value: The paper presents a THz photonic-based ISAC system with full-photonic direct LFM reception and de-chirping for fiber-wireless networks. The system uses a thin-film lithium niobate Mach-Zehnder modulator (TFLN-MZM) for direct reception and de-chirping of D-band LFM signals.

The system achieves a range resolution of 6 mm and a peak data rate of 116 Gbit/s at a center frequency of 134 GHz, with a calibrated mean ranging error of less than 3 mm. The results are verified through experiments and simulations.

The system demonstrates the potential for high-performance communication and sensing in future 6G networks. The use of TFLN-MZM enables direct reception and de-chirping of THz LFM signals, mitigating the impact of frequency instability and allowing for coherent accumulation of radar sensing signals.

bibliographic.title: THz Integrated Sensing and Communication With Full-Photonic Direct LFM Reception and De-Chirping for D-Band Fiber-Wireless Network
bibliographic.authors: Boyu Dong, Zhongya Li, Sizhe Xing, Yinjun Liu, Junhao Zhao, Ouhan Huang, Junlian Jia, Jianyang Shi, Yingjun Zhou, Haipeng Wang, Nan Chi, Junwen Zhang
bibliographic.venue: IEEE Transactions on Microwave Theory and Techniques

application.scenario_description: Fiber-wireless network with integrated sensing and communication capabilities

key_contribution.key_contribution: Full-photonic direct LFM reception and de-chirping for D-band fiber-wireless networks
key_contribution.gap_addressed: Mitigation of frequency instability and improvement of radar sensing performance

quality_assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a well-designed experiment with clear results and discussion.
